description: {"blocks":[{"key":"552sm","text":"The protocol described here is a multi-day extraction protocol for the recovery of fragment DNA molecules from bone or teeth powder obtained from ancient or historical remains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l1sr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v8at","text":"The protocol is based on a silica-column method described initially in (Yang et al, 1998). Further modifications were made to this base protocol and reported (MacHugh et al, 2000), (Gamba et al, 2014), (Daly et al, 2018), and (Verdugo et al, 2019). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4ada","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4np0","text":"The instructions presented here describe the totality of these modifications and are one of the aDNA extraction methods employed by the Molecular Population Genetics group at Trinity College Dublin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"62etv","text":"Sodium Hypochlorite (14%, dilute to 0.5%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9j0q","text":"Water (Laboratory grade)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agf2p","text":"EDTA (0.5M, pH 8)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87j7f","text":"Tris-HCl (1M, pH final)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6svi5","text":"Proteinase K (2.5 U/mg or 50U/mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gep2","text":"Tween (20%) warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"fp4v","text":"The described protocol should be performed in dedicated ancient DNA facilities. Workers should wear full-body PPE (gloves x2, body suits, masks) to avoid contamination of material. Extra care must be made to avoid cross-contamination of low concentration material typical of ancient/historical DNA projects.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
